inn1.comm: easily clips this back of length delivery down to fine leg to get off the mark
shuffles across and whips the length delivery to midwicket
digs it in at short of length, the batsman stays back and defends
another shortish delivery, keeps Shehzad on the back foot and he defends it to off
this one beats the outside the edge! It was similar sort of shortish length but this just flies past the bat, at a good heigh

first full delivery fetches the wicket! What a blow. He was keeping the batsmen back  and slips in the fuller one to surprise Shehzad. The batsman was a touch slow to come forward and gives a simple chance to the keeper
waits on the back foot and steers the length delivery through point. The fielder gets a hand to it to slow it down

another one! Two ducks in the top order. The umpire takes ages to decide but it looked plumb the moment the ball thudded into the front pad. It was on the middle stump line and Younis just played down the wrong line.. Younis checks with his partner if he should review.. But hey hey hey.. This is a huge no-ball.. Funny.. Varun Aaron got David Warner bowled off a no-ball earlier.
slower bouncer is the weapon of choice from the bowler. Younis is a touch surprised but manages to roll his wrist over that as he pulls this down to fine leg
back of length delivery but this is down the leg side
a very good delivery, swinging in from the middle stump, but an equally well-played shot! He gets in line and glances it fine on the leg side
slower delivery on the stumps, Younis walks into this defensive shot
this is poor line! Way outside off
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to the off side

that no-ball hasn't hurt much! There is no celebration from Mitch this time.. They are checking for a no-ball. Younis was stuck in the crease and pokes at an angled delivery, only manages to edge it to Taylor at first slip. This one's fine. Absolutely fine.
quick back of length delivery, Hafeez jabs at it and pulls it straight to midwicket
he waits on the back foot and defends the back of length delivery to the off side
slightly further up but not a full one, the batsman comes forward and defends
keeps pushing him back with back of length delivery, Hafeez defends it to point
keeps it in the channel outside off, the length is further up, Hafeez pushes forward and defends to cover

look at that! Shehzad would have loved to do that. Henry bowls it full outside off, the same sort of delivery that got him a wicket, but Hafeez leans into it and just punches it through mid-off. Be-autiful
teasing line from Mitch. It's fuller and angling away from the batsman. Shafiq leaves it alone
he gets off the mark with a leading edge to extra cover! Shafiq wanted to drive this through towards mid-on
fuller and wider outside off, Hafeez moves forward and drives it straight to cover
back of length delivery outside off, left alone
he is keeping it there and thereabouts outside off, left alone again
superbly driven! Hafeez is alert and doesn't waste the half-volley, leans forward and crunches it through cover
loud appeal for lbw as the batsman plays around this length delivery and is struck on the front pad. He wasn't too far forward. I guess the inside edge saved Shafiq there
back of length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket

full, fast and furious! The stumps have been splayed. This is exhilarating stuff from New Zealand. Henry pushes this further up and keeps it on the middle stump line.. Shafiq wanted to flick it but that was a bit too quick, flies through the gate and whacks the stumps
another outside edge! Not too far from the second slip fielder. Sohail was actually taking his bat away from the line but was a touch late
digs it in halfway on the pitch at 142.5 kph, it sails over the batsman's head
length delivery outside off, Hafeez comes forward and defends it to off
nice lines from Mitch Mc! this is just outside off and it makes the batsman play. Sohail defends it from the crease

oh wow! The effort ball almost brings a wicket. Sohail is late in his defence and fends it awkwardly to the off side. .He had no clue where that was headed. Just lands at gully.. to the left of backward point
no problems with the short ball for Hafeez! He has whacked this with some authority through square leg
another bouncer! This one is a bit too high and is called a wide
fuller this time, 137 kph, Hafeez dabs it with soft hands to mid-off and calls for a quick one
he stays stuck in the crease and gets an inside edge on to his pads as he pushes at this length ball
whips this off his hips but finds the man at square leg
another appeal for lbw as this one hits the pads at 142 kph, but this one was slipping down leg though
length delivery on the stumps, defended to midwicket
what timing this! He came forward and just pushed it towards the non-striker.. More of a check shot. But this picks up speed once it crosses the umpire and beats the mid-on fielder
shuffles across and whips the length delivery to midwicket

full and on the middle line! Hafeez's hands are quicker than Shafiq.. he flicks it to deep backward square leg for a couple. A bit tricky for the fielder down there as his knee gets stuck on the turn while sliding
back of length on off, defended to cover
length delivery on off, the batsman stays back and defends it to cover
he comes half-forward and punches it on the up down the ground.. That was superbly timed but it was not that well-placed.. It was just an inch away from Milne's right hand.
shorter delivery this time, the batsman ducks under it
leans into this length ball, 151 kph, punched through to cover
another bouncer, and again the batsman ducks under it
that is quick! It shows 146 kph on the radar, but it looks quicker. Short, and flies through to the keeper after the batsman had swayed away from the line
full and sliding down the leg side, Hafeez misses out on a flick and gets hit on the pads
stays back to the length delivery, defends it down to mid-on
quick single to midwicket and Hafeez makes it in with a dive
stays on the back foot and defends the back of length delivery to off
shortish delivery outside off, 142 kph, looks quicker. Sohail sways out of the line
stays back and tucks away the short of length delivery to wide mid-on for a single
fuller on the stumps, at least 25 mph faster than a Cheetah, but the batsman whips it easily to fine leg for a single
he short-arm pulls it through wide mid-on for a couple. It was a length ball outside off but Hafeez is into his shot early
rides the bounce and guides the 149 kph short of length delivery to third man for a single
nicely handled! It's on the hips and he nudges it cleanly down to fine leg
fuller delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to mid-on
leans forward and punches this 148 kph missile to mid-on
superbly done from Sohail! He leans forward into this fuller delivery but uses his wrists to whip it wide of mid-on.. That's stylish
keeps it outside off but Sohail leaves this one alone
pounds this on the pitch halfway, it sails over the batsman who is already down on his haunches
he comes forward to this length delivery and defends it solidly
very very nicely played! He gets on top of this bounce by rising up on his toes, then punches it through the tiny gap at cover point. It is hauled back from the boundary but he gets three there
pull, top-edge, safe! Hafeez's penchant for the pull shot almost does him here. He gets a big top edge but it lands safely a few meters in front of fine leg
they all love the slow stuff! Hafeez was out of the crease even before the bowler released it.. Gets a tossed up delivery and he smashes it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
tossed up on off, pushed to cover
quicker delivery this time, the batsman punches it to cover
shorter and flatter, Hafeez was looking for the gap at backward point but can't beat the fielder
he comes down the pitch but the bowler slows it down, Hafeez has to lunge and push it through to long off
tossed up and slow, the batsman pushes it to cover point for a single
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
back of length delivery on off, the batsman stays back and defends to off
another bouncer, now Sohail ducks under it to get out of the way
he comes forward to the length delivery and pushes to cover
straighter and on a length, easily flicked down to fine leg
short of length and angled away from the right-hander, Hafeez sways out of line
flatter delivery on off, the batsman chops it to short third man
this could have been tricky! There was an outside edge that went straight to short third man.. But Hafeez called immediately and would have been short had the fielder hit the stumps
stays back and defends the length delivery down the pitch
waits in the crease and cuts it to point
waits in the crease and defends the flatter delivery down the pitch
steps out but he is not to the pitch of the delivery, defends it
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
stays back in the crease and defends the length delivery to off
short of length delivery at 150 kph, the batsman hops on to his toes and defends it to the leg side
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to point
rides the bounce and glides it down to third man for a single
length delivery on off, chopped towards point
straight on the pads, the batsman flicks it straight to short fine leg
flatter and on the leg stump line, tickled straight to short fine leg again
pushed through but this is well outside off, all he had to do was place this in the gap.. He used the pace and cuts it through point
awesome! Now he steps out and smashes this flighted delivery to the sight screen. He knew it was going to be flighted
slower this time from the bowler, Hafeez dabs it to cover and calls for a quick one.
short delivery on off, the batsman sways away from the line
fuller delivery, no problems for the batsman to punch it through to cover
that is pacy! Short and at 147.4. The keeper has to leap up to catch that
he stays back and nudges it to midwicket for a quick single
stands tall and punches the back of length delivery to Devcich at point
he stays back and glides it down to third man for a single
fuller and on the stumps, defended to the leg side
steps out and pushes the flighted delivery to mid-on
slides this one in from wide of the crease, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he comes down the pitch and gets a juicy full toss, that has been swatted away through midwicket with a wristy flick. A lot of bottom-hand in that shot
comes forward and pushes the fuller delivery back to the bowler
tossed up on off, Hafeez squeezes it to point and looks for a single, but he is sent back
he waits in the crease and clips the length delivery to deep backward square leg
he comes forward and defends the length delivery to cover
he gets to his half-century with a neat flick to fine-leg! He raises his bat. Superb effort till now
he stays back and rides the bounce to guide the short ball to third man
he waits in the crease and guides the length delivery to third man
short ball outside off, Sohail sways away from the line
flatter and on off stump, eased through to deep cover for a single
full and wide outside off, Sohail drives it firmly but straight to cover
big shot! big result! he comes down the pitch and lofts the fuller delivery over wide long-on.. Clears the boundary comfortably.. Superb timing

looks for a cut and gets an underedge that the keeper is not able to hold on to. It slides to short third-man and they go for a quick single. The throw is hard and the fielder at long-off had to do a bit of work, but he gives away an overthrow
length delivery, defended to the leg side
he works this away through midwicket to keep the strike

what a waste that is! Sohail has pulled this short delivery straight into the hands of short midwicket! Taylor was looking into the sun but reacted quickly enough to hold on to that. A little better connection and it would have been safe. Anderson is all smiles.. he knows it's a wicket for him that's come from nowhere
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes behind the line and defends it to off
sharp bouncer this time, Misbah ducks under it
he shuffles across and gets behind the short delivery, glides it down to third man
he pushes forward to the fuller delivery and slices it to point
fires it full on the middle and leg line, the batsman whips it to the leg side but finds the man at midwicket
inside edge as Misbah pushes at it away from the body, that ricochets on to his thigh pad
fuller delivery on the stumps, defended to the off side
quicker and flatter outside off, he chops it to the off side but can't beat point
comes out of the crease and defends this one to cover

flatter and on the stumps, punched back to the bowler. .But .. but.. the bowler flicks it between his legs and hits the stumps.. Hafeez was standing out of the crease.. He is just.. only just... safe.. That was very very close and would have been the most awful way to get out
he nudges this one to square leg for a single to keep the strike

a boundary for Misbah through back foot defence! Misbah defended it to the leg side.. Hafeez charged halfway down the pitch.. Milne beat him.. got there, picked the ball and fired a throw back at the stumps at 200 kph probably.. the mid-on had no chance to stop that. It would have been out had he hit though
no question about this one! Misbah stands tall and steers the pacy delivery through point for a superbly timed boundary
stays back and defends the length delivery to cover
stays back and defends the back of length delivery towards point
short delivery, Misbah bends his back and gets under it easily
angled in from wide of the crease, Misbah calmly clips it to fine leg for a single
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
slower this time, the batsman reaches out and defends it again
too straight this time, Misbah dabs it to midwicket for a quick single
he comes down the pitch but the bowler pushes it wide. Hafeez cuts, but finds the fielder at point
"catch it" is the call.. The batsman comes down the pitch and mistimes the lofted shot.. Williamson runs towards mid-on from midwicket and leaps for it, but just out of his reach
quicker delivery on the stumps, defended to the leg side
bowls it wide on a length, Hafeez stretches forward and punches it to deep cover
puts in a lot of effort in digging it short, but that just takes it way over the batsman
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and steers it down to third man
another comfortable push through cover for a single
wider line from Milne, 145.2 kph, Misbah leaves it alone
he walks into fuller length delivery and flicks it to mid-on for a quick single

oh that was close! Taylor is not far from any of these edges. He was at the floating slip position and Hafeez almost steered this short delivery into his hands. It was just a meter to his right. He gets a hand to it too..
comes down the pitch and looks for the big shot but gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg
stays back and defends the length delivery to the off side
he waits on the back foot and cuts the flatter delivery to deep point
pushed through on the off, eased to deep point off the back foot for another single
slower and on the stumps, Misbah comes forward and defends it down the pitch
shorter and on the pads, Misbah whips it to deep backward square leg
he dabs the length delivery towards backward point but Hafeez wants it.. he wants to be at the other end and makes it.. A direct hit would have caught him short
back of length on off, chopped straight to backward point
pushes away from the body at this wide delivery, almost slices it into the hands of the point fielder
short ball at 145 kph, the batsman ducks under it
length delivery, he dabs it to point for a quick single
back of length outside off, Misbah defends it to point
length delivery on off, the batsman steers it down to third man
he stays in the crease and pushes it to cover.. Hafeez wants a single again before going back.
length delivery on the stumps, Misbah defends it to point
some width this time but it is always coming in from round the stumps, Misbah chops it to point
he goes for a pull as soon as he sees the shorter length, but this is quick.. it flies past the helmet
he waits on the back foot and steers the back of length delivery straight to point
slower and on the stumps, the batsman tucks it to the left of point for a single
on the pads, the batsman nudges it behind square on the leg side for another quick single
drifting on to the pads, Hafeez goes back and tickles it to short fine leg
slower and tossed up, the batsman leans forward and defends
fast hands from Misbah as he cuts this one through point, but there is protection in the deep
on the pads again, Misbah finds it easy to deal with these, turns it through square leg
length delivery outside off from round the wicket, the batsman continues to pick runs to third man
back of the hand slower delivery, the batsman is beaten by it and doesn't make a connection as looks for another dab to third man
he comes down the pitch but Anderson ramps up the pace and digs it short.. The batsman is a bit surprised and he swats it to midwicket without any timing
short outside off, Misbah drags it with a flat-batted shot to wide mid-on for a single
he spots the slower delivery early this time and whacks it over midwicket for a boundary. It's been quite a while since the last one was hit
comes down the pitch but it's the pacy short one outside off, he is beaten by that
he leans forward and punches the length delivery to long off
he looks to chop it through point but gets an underedge that was not far from the off stump
stays back and punches it to deep cover
slower and on the pads, the batsman dabs it to the leg side, but it's not too far from the keeper
comes down the pitch and drives, finds the man at cover
comes forward and punches this one down to long off
fires it full outside off, the batsman squeezes it to point
he waits in the crease and steers it down to third man
he shuffles across and punches the length delivery to midwicket
full and wide outside off, Hafeez has to stretch out and he squeezes it down to third man
he gets behind the line of this length delivery and punches it to deep cover
slower delivery with lots of width, the batsman crunches it off the back foot but Devcich, at point, dives to his right to cut it off
drifting on to the pads, the batsman nudges it to short fine leg for a quick single
he moves to the leg side to give him some room, then defends the flighted delivery to the off
moves to the leg side again.. then it's the Misbah trademark big hit! He does that so easily everytime.. Smashes it over long with such ease. Huge huge hit.. It's out of the ground
back to block block. He defends this flatter delivery to the leg side
he comes forward and pushes it towards point
flatter and shorter outside off, Misbah waits on the back foot and punches it firmly to deep extra cover
stays in the crease and dabs the length delivery to point
whack! That is sweet. It's marginally short outside off but Hafeez is quick to rock back and swivels to murder it over midwicket
fires in a yorker outside off, the batsman jabs it to Devcich at point and scampers through for a single
he is cramped for room from that round the wicket line, defends the length delivery to point
fuller on off and Misbah goes big again! What a strike. He smashes it to the sight screen with such ease. One day, I am sure, he will six sixes in an over
fuller length delivery, he could have hit this one for six too, but he defends it to point
length delivery outside off, the batsman chops it straight to point
Whoa! Big hit but he is gone. A zero sum game. He swivels and plays a fine pull.. but plays it straight to the man at deep midwicket. The fielder doesn't have to move an inch.
he is so comfortable with the flick, gets off the mark immediately with one to fine leg
short of length delivery outside off, the batsman defends it to point again. Just like a Cheetah
short delivery again, the batsman gets under it in time
he is hurried by the short ball but manages to control the pull, plays it down to deep square leg
length delivery from round the stumps, dabbed to the off side for a single
he stays low and steers the length ball past that slip fielder for a single

oh how lucky is that for Misbah! he dabs it to point and takes off for a single.. like a Cheetah.. He is halfway down. Devcich had so much time.. He decides to lob it to Ronchi.. who overruns the ball and Misbah survives
short ball this time, Misbah looks to pull but makes no connection
he leans forward and carves the fuller delivery to deep extra cover
fuller delivery on off, the batsman whips it to deep midwicket with a wristy flick
back of length outside off, dropped towards point and they take off for a single
more hesitation as the batsman dabs it to the off side and sends Misbah back
he shuffles on the crease and works away the short of length delivery to deep midwicket
good short ball at 139 kph, Misbah ducks under it

they appeal for a caught behind and Illingworth immediately lifts the finger.. the bowler had actually given up on the appeal -- he had his hands on his head. It was only Ronchi appealing. But the bowler is pleasantly surprised. It was a bouncer again and Misbah went for a hook, but missed. This one goes over his left shoulder and looked good in the real time. Misbah reviews it immediately. The replays look like they would support Illingworth and that is what the decision is. Misbah has to go, despite him gesturing that it was off his fore-arm. He is not happy. But Henry has four now
he shuffles across to the off side and whips the length ball to deep midwicket
fuller delivery on off, Afridi punches it to the off side but can't beat cover
the day of bouncers continues.. the batsman ducks under it well in time
he goes back and works it away to square leg for a single
he looks to flat-bat this short delivery down the ground but gets an underedge on to the pitch
quick single to midwicket but Sir Fraz dives and makes it to the other end. Williamson missed the stumps.. and would have been out had he hit
back of length on the stumps, tucked away to backward square leg for a single
looks to cramp the batsman for room but this slides down the leg side
length delivery outside off, Sir Fraz guides it past the diving point fielder for a couple of runs to the deep
fuller outside off, the batsman looks to drive it through cover but his back foot slides back and he ends up slicing it to point
dabs it with soft hands to the left of Devcich at backward point, calls for a quick single
that's a propah connection from Afridi! he moves to the leg side and whacks the length delivery over wide long-off. That has sailed over the ropes with ease
short ball again, the batsman ducks under it
short ball on the body but look at Lala, he arches back and guides it fine on the off-side.. A fine touch that one
length delivery on off, the batsman dabs it to point for a quick single
he misses out as he guides the low full toss straight to point
good tight length delivery from Mitch, the batsman dabs it to the left of point for a single
short of length delivery, the batsman guides it down to third-man for a single
goes for the big swivel pull but misses as this gets big on him. The short balls have been a constant feature of the day
another short ball but this is a bit too high, called a wide
quick and on the stumps, Afridi dabs it to the off side and calls for a quick single
whoa superb! Pace or no pace, Afridi is not going to stop swinging. It's a length ball and he has just whacked it over long on with utter ease
slap, drop and a six! Afridi gets width outside off and he frees his arms, whacking it over point and Brownlie is not able to wraps his fingers around this.. It bursts through and goes over the line
ooh Lala.. Afridi doesn't know when to apply brakes! Keeps going for the big swing but there is no room on this one and all he can do is top-edge the pull. Vettori at mid-off gobbles up the skier
fuller on the stumps at 150 kph, the batsman pushes it to cover
that's too quick for Riaz. He comes forward to push this through off but it has already gone through
on the pads, Riaz tucks it to backward square leg for a single
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
quicker on the pads, the batsman pushes it down to long on
flatter and outside off, the batsman steers it to deep cover
this one is dabbed to cover for a quick single
flatter and on the stumps, it's pushed to cover with soft hands for a single
fuller on the stumps, pushed to extra cover for a single
fires in a yorker at 146 kph, the batsman digs it out towards point
fuller delivery on off again, the batsman dabs it towards point with soft hands for another single
that's a quick one outside off, 147 kph. Riaz looks for it with his bat but it's in the keeper's gloves
short and on the body, Riaz hops and jumps, gets out of the way somehow. Then he practices the straight drive
short and on the body, the batsman wanted to turn it to the leg side but ends up pushing it down the pitch as he is slow on it
full but down the leg side, flicked to fine leg and Riaz keeps strike
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman punches it to deep cover
slower bouncer, this goes over the head of the batsman .. tennis ball bounce as they say
short of length on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to midwicket for a single
he hops on his toes and whips the short of length ball to deep square leg
another short ball, this one sails over the batsman again
wider length delivery, Sarfraz carves it straight to point
another quick single as the batsman dabs it towards point
dabs this one to point for another quick single
superb from Riaz! Fuller delivery on the stumps and the batsman gets behind the line in time, creams it through extra cover
fuller and quicker outside off, the batsman is beaten as he stays rooted to the crease
on the stumps, this time he clips it to deep midwicket
back of length outside off, 150 kph, chopped straight to backward point
another short ball, the batsman gets up on his toes and nudges it to square leg
Milne takes his second with a quick short of length delivery.. Riaz rose up with it but could only manage and edge straight to first slip. Fourth career wicket for Milne
length delivery on off, the batsman punches it straight to mid-off
he walks across to the off side to clip it towards square leg, but gets an inside edge on to the pads that ricochets towards point

he comes forward and pushes it to mid-on for a quick single. The throw from the fielder beats everyone and ends up at third-man, but Tanvir is in no position to return.. he is almost as far as the start of his bowling run up
looks to pull but is surprised by the pace.. it lobs up back down the pitch but lands short of the bowler
short and wide outside off, Sarfraz guides it down to third man
he stays back and whips it with the angle to deep square leg
angled away from the left-hander, Tanvir glides it to third man
short ball on off stump, the batsman moves his front leg out and flat-bats it towards mid-on for a quick single
short ball from round the stumps, the batsman gets a leading edge towards off as he closes the face of the bat too early, but picks up a single
back of length and rising outside off, the batsman slides it down to third man
misses out as he pushes a full toss to midwicket with soft hands
short delivery, the batsman pulls it down to fine leg to keep the strike
length delivery outside off, Sarfraz wanted to punch it through cover but misses it altogether
fires in the blockhole and Sarfraz can only squeeze it out to extra cover
an appeal for caught behind from Mitchell only. No one else joins in.. The batsman missed the slower bouncer there. He was trying to steer it to third man
he slaps it to mid-on and looks for a single, but gives it up as he realises he is not going to make it. The fielder though misses the stumps
shortish delivery on the stumps, Sarfraz pulls it down to fine leg
short outside off, but that one sat up nicely.. Sohail Tanvir leaned forward and flat bats it over midwicket for a welcome boundary

he is gone! Sarfraz has had to wait throughout this innings to open his arms. Last two overs, he thought this was the time. He looks to swing the length delivery down the ground but gets a big top edge that swirls in the air and settles down at cover. No boundaries today for him

whoa! This is a yorker on the middle and leg from round the stumps, but Tanvir moves to the off side and paddles it expertly to the fine-leg boundary. Mitch was appealing for an lbw, but the only thing it hit was the middle of the bat

he misses the full toss and he has to go. Illingworth raises his finger. It hit him on the thigh pad but that was a good call from the umpire. It was hitting the middle. Tanvir wants to review it, but there are none left

inn2.comm: gets this one to swerve away from the right-hander, the batsman leaves it alone
more of that away movement but it starts at around off stump, easily left alone
superb delivery! This one follows the same arc but it pitches on leg stump, confusing the batsman in the process. Brownlie is squared up as he is beaten by this
waits on the back foot and pushes the length delivery to cover
it's on a length but he again stays back, the batsman defends it to cover point
it's marginally short and gives the batsman time to squeeze the back foot punch through the gap between cover and point, breaks the sequence of dots
good bounce straightaway! It jags back from a length and whacks the thigh pad. Devcich was hopping at the crease too
gets squared up a touch in defence, pushed through point for a single
cracker of a shot! This is short and wide outside off, easy pickings.
better line from Irfan, it's closer to off stump. The batsman defends it to point
he stays back to the length delivery on off stump, defends it to cover
bowls it full but this is down the leg side
shortish and climbing, the batsman punches it to cover point off the back foot
he stands tall and doesn't bother about the inward movement, punches it straight past the non-striker for three. It wasn't off the middle of the bat, more of the inside half
short of length but this is down the leg side
it's on the pads, the batsman misses the flick but it kisses the pads and rolls down to fine leg
wide delivery outside off. Devcich misses. He didn't really move closer to the line, just tried to throw his bat at that
no feet movement, he stays in the crease and punches the length delivery to cover
stays back and punches the length delivery firmly to mid-on
he comes half forward and defends the length delivery solidly down the pitch
fuller on off, Brownlie brings his bat down firmly on that and punches it straight back at the bowler
he is staying within the crease, defends this 145 kph delivery back down the pitch
back of length and gets a bit big on the batsman, who defends it towards point
it's not short enough but Brownlie pulls it from the middle stump, straight to midwicket though

nasty nasty delivery at 145 kph! That could have got him a wicket 9 out of 10 times. It pitched on short of length and took off, caught the shoulder of the bat and lobbed over gully and down to the boundary
another pacy snorter! Brownlie goes for a cut but this beats the outside edge
he fails to get bat on this inswinging delivery, but picks up a leg bye towards square leg
serves this on the pads and it's whipped through square leg with ease
waits in the crease and punches the length delivery to cover
punched to short cover again, off the back foot
fuller delivery outside off but the batsman was stuck in the crease, he tried to slap it through covers but missed it completely
stays back and pushes the length delivery to mid-off
superbly hit! This one climbs towards him but he gets on top of it, smashes it through cover point
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward -- only just -- and pushes it back to the bowler
fuller, but this slides down the leg side
he chops this length delivery down to third-man for a single
beautifully hit! Brownlie stands at the crease and helps this short and wide delivery over the point fielder.. Easily done. He used all the available pace from the bowler and used it against him
doesn't really come forward but punches the fuller delivery nicely to mid-off
nasty short one again, on the body and the batsman has to arch back to get out of the way
he stays in the crease and punches the length ball back at the bowler
he dabs this to wide mid-on with a calm push and calls for a quick single
he stays back and punches the length delivery to cover, past the man at short cover
back of length outside off, the batsman plays a checked drive to cover
he gives away a freebie with a length ball down the leg side
he is stuck to the crease but punches the length ball firmly back to the bowler
slightly slower, the batsman waits and pushes it to wide mid-off for a quick single
he is welcomed with a neat flick off the pads. Wahab served it on the pads and Brownlie takes full toll
looks to slash at a length delivery outside off, makes no connection as this doesn't bounce as much as he anticipated
back of length outside off, he gets behind the line and punches it solidly towards mid-off
on the pads again and easily clipped to deep backward square leg
no swing from the bowler, it comes nicely on to the bat at 143 kph, Devcich defends
goes for the release slog but inside edges it towards square leg. It wasn't short enough but Dev was aiming for midwicket boundary there
brings it back in and cramps the batsman for room, it hits on the pads but that was going down
superbly planned and expertly executed! Tanvir doesn't have much pace so Dev moves down the pitch and chips it beautifully over mid-off
length delivery on off, he leans forward and pushes it to cover
length delivery on the stumps, this time his punches it to mid-on
slower delivery outside off, Anton Dev had to wait a bit.. it was only 105 kph.. then he slashes it behind point
another slowish delivery outside  off, this time Anton Dev punches it to cover
that's the 50 of New Zealand.. Quick delivery, but down the leg side and called a wide. Superb start for New Zealand
very very nicely played! It's short and wide, always rising, so he uses the pace and whacks it over point easily
stays back and punches the 143 kph length delivery to midwicket
punches it in the air, but punches it in the gap! It's beautifully timed. Not much room outside off but Brownlie stays back and pushes it through cover
another one! superb stuff from Brownlie but poor bowling from Wahab. It's on the hips and Brownlie glances it down to the fine-leg boundary easily
that's through Shafiq at cover point! It is crashed from the crease and straight to the fielder, but he merely slows it down
back of length and wide outside off, Anton Dev is annoyed as he makes no connection with his cut shot
pushed through on the pads, the batsman whips it to deep square leg for a single
shorter still, Anton Dev waits and cuts it through to deep point with ease
appeal for caught behind down the leg side, but the umpire calls it a wide. Afridi doesn't like it
quicker delivery on the stumps, punched to cover
drifting on to the pads, tickled to short fine leg for a single
slower this time from Lala, dabbed towards square leg
looks to paddle this full delivery but toe-ends it to the off side
tossed up outside off, the batsman looks to cut but misses as it stays low
goes back and punches the flatter delivery to deep cover
tossed up on the stumps, punched straight to mid-off
gives this plenty of air and Anton Dev crashes this through covers. There will be aggression against the part-timer, it seems
turn and bounce! Surprises the batsman as he is cramped for room
on the pads, it's whipped to deep midwicket for a single
he goes for the reverse sweep, along with Lala's angle, but finds the man at third man
quicker slider outside off, Anton Dev wanted to cut but gets beaten
on the pads, he goes back and clips it down to fine leg
fuller and on the pads, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
goes on the back foot and punches it straight to short cover
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman drives it back to the bowler
he goes for the big sweep but gets a big top edge that lands safely short of fine leg
comes out of the crease and creates room too, slices it over cover with an inside out shot that lands short of the fielder in the deep
well wide outside off but Anton Dev had decided where he was going to go.. he drags it powerfully to the midwicket boundary
tossed up outside off, he goes through off now, driven to deep cover
comes forward and eases the tossed up delivery to long on
he uses his feet and clips the fuller delivery to deep midwicket
tossed up on off, the batsman defends it solidly to cover
goes back and tucks the flatter delivery to short fine leg
superb delivery! Slower, flighted, it then turns away from the left-hander to beat the outside edge.. and the off stump
oh he was ready with his reverse paddle! Unlike the last time, he plays it very very fine and the short third man had no chance to stop this one
pushed through on the pads, he dabs it straight to midwicket
another quicker one on the pads, the batsman pushes it straight to midwicket
length delivery on off, the batsman stands tall and punches it to cover
he hasn't come forward all day, he won't come now. The batsman defends the length ball to midwicket
quick short one that flies past the batsman's face at 139 kph.. it looked much faster than that. I am sure Brownlie would agree
back of length outside off, Brownlie crashes it off the back foot but finds Shehzad at point
another bouncer, this time the batsman gets under it in time
goes on the back foot and whips the length delivery through wide mid-on for a double C (Cute couple)
fuller delivery on the stumps, pushed down the ground
on the stumps, he punches this to mid-on
quick single to mid-off, Anton Dev has to dive to get in
he waits in the crease and cracks it past point
take that! Afridi serves it wide and it is crashed through cover point with a powerful cut
tossed up on the stumps, Anton Dev takes it on the full and paddles it to fine leg
that's a snorter again! Short of length and rising, it beats the batsman cut shot as it gets big on him
waits on the back foot and chops the length delivery down to third man  for  a double S
double B (Backfoot Brownlie - Courtesy Balladeer) brings up the century of the stand with a flick down to fine leg
goes for the big hook shot but doesn't get hold of it, gets a top edge towards fine leg
he stays back and defends the shortish delivery down the pitch
pounds it on the pitch but he has overstepped on this one
he misses out on the free-hit! It was a high full toss and it eludes the stumps too.
wants to drive the tossed up delivery but gets a thick inside edge to fine leg

and double B does the double S! Boom Boom's special delivery, which doesn't do anything.. just keeps coming in and Backfoot Brownlie just got cramped for room. It hits the top of middle. The Shahid Slider did the job there
on the pads, the batsman defends it down the pitch
sliding down the leg side again, it is tickled to short fine leg for a single
tossed up on the stump, the batsman whips it straight to midwicket
short and comes with some width, Anton Dev chops it to deep cover
length delivery on the pads, the batsman whips it to deep square leg with ease
he stays rooted to the crease as he looks to push this angled delivery to off, that zips past the outside edge
back of length on the stumps, tucked away to deep midwicket
reaches his maiden half-century with a clip off the pads that runs down to fine-leg
special shot from a special batsman! Wahab delivers a half-volley and Williamson just caresses it through cover. Beautifully done
stays in the crease and defends the back of the length delivery down the pitch
goes back and punches the flatter delivery to long-on
leans forward and defends the tossed up delivery solidly to the off side
comes forward and eases the fuller delivery to long off
comes forward and punches it to long off
comes forward and defends it to midwicket
loud appeal for lbw as the batsman comes forward in defence but there is a big inside edge there
he continues leaking runs, this time it's down the leg side
digs this one short and the batsman gets out of the way in time. Wahab gives an extended stare to the batsman. Anton Dev has nothing to worry about. He has the best beard in cricket
he stays in the crease and defends the length ball solidly down the pitch
hops on the crease and tucks the length delivery to square leg for a single
superb again! He stretches out and drives the fuller delivery on-the-up to deep cover, just a single but it looks really pretty
another short ball from Wahab. Anton Dev is not perturbed at all
he rocks back and defends the back of length delivery to the off side

that's a close shout for lbw! It's that slider again and Williamson was stuck in the crease.. The bat is really close to the pad. No review asked. It was the pad first.. but it was probably going down
tossed up and on the stumps, the batsman defends it off the front foot
quicker one, the batsman defends it to the off side

superb chip shot! He is quick on his feet as he comes out of the crease and picks it up over midwicket. Umar Akmal slides at the boundary to stop it but he touched the rope while he had the ball in his hand
sliding down, the batsman nudges it to short fine leg
full and flighted now, Williamson pushes forward and drives it to long off
length delivery outside off, goes away with the angle, Williamson calmly lets it go through
tight lines around off at 139 kph, Williamson shuffles across and defends it solidly
better lines from Wahab. Williamson defends the length delivery to the leg side
back of length and too straight, Williamson goes back and across, clips it down to fine leg
he waits on the back foot and chops the back of length delivery down to third man
fuller length with some width, Williamson moves forward and chops it straight to point
that's a long hop.. it's slow and it's short. Anton Dev has all the time to wait and line up his shot. He whacks it through midwicket with a powerful pull
just short of mid-off! It was full on the off and the batsman went for the big drive, but just miscued it.
goes on the back foot and clips the flatter delivery straight to backward square leg

what a waste! Dev is hugely disappointed... He played a nice reverse paddle straight to short third man.. Williamson wanted the run and he was charging down the pitch. Anton Dev started late and his only hope was the fielder going for the wrong end. It didn't happen and Sohail whips off the bails
flighted on off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
he waits in the crease and punches it down to long off
long hop outside off, enough time for Williamson to murder it over midwicket for a boundary. Perfectly in the gap there
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
fuller and on the middle, the batsman digs it out to cover
short and wide outside off, the batsman punches it to deep cover with ease
nicely tossed up on the stumps, Taylor dabs it towards point
loopy delivery, Taylor takes it on the full and punches it to long on
he comes out of the crease and defends the tossed up delivery
steps out of the crease, the batsman pushes it to mid-off

Sohail strikes, his maiden wicket in ODIs! What a big one this is! It was not short enough but Taylor went for the cut nonetheless, he underedges it to the keeper. Taylor was looking like he was about to walk, but he waited an extra second.. the umpire took his time and finally sent him on his way
poor delivery! Short and down the leg side, Latham pulls it powerfully down to fine leg
tossed up on the leg stump line, the batsman flicks it down to fine leg
floated on the leg stump line, Latham loves to sweep, he plays this down to fine leg
hits the thigh pad with one that comes in off a length, Latham plays outside the line
this one cuts in again and slides between the bat and pad! misses the off stump too.
rising delivery on the ribs, Latham fends it to the leg side for a quick single
back of length on the stumps, the batsman rises with it then defends it down the pitch
waits on the back foot and defends the back-of-length delivery towards point
stays back and cuts this length delivery down to third man for a single
short and wide, comes slow off the surface.. Williamson was looking to punch it through covers, but ends up toe-ending it back to the bowler
he comes down the pitch and chips it over wide mid-on. There were shouts of "catch it" as Umar Akmal ran towards it from long on, but it was just out of reach
waits in the crease and punches it to long on
flatter on off, Latham goes for the sweep but finds the man at backward square leg

another one for Sohail! This is the mirror image of what Williamson did two balls ago - steps out of the crease and looks to chip through wide long-on, but unfortunately for Latham, the fielder - Tanvir - was in the right place.
flatter and outside off, the batsman crunches it to deep cover
back of length on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he watches the ball carefully, sees it rising and then pulls it down to deep square leg
sharp short delivery! The batsman fends it from right in front of his face. And Anderson is a tall man. That reared up from just short of length
another superb delivery! He gets those to get up from a length.. Anderson hops and defends this
fuller delivery outside off, Anderson comes forward and pushes it to wide mid-off for a single
stays back and defends the length delivery to the off side
full and flighted on the stumps, Anderson comes forward and punches it to long on
nicely tossed up on the stumps, Williamson lunges forward and defends
flighted on the middle and leg line, pushed down to long on for a single
goes on the back foot and tucks away the flatter delivery to deep midwicket
he is hurried into the pull, plays it in the air through the vacant midwicket area for a couple
full and flighted, the batsman comes forward and punches it down to long off
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
he comes forward and pushes the flatter delivery to long on
he comes forward and just punches it down the ground without any backlift.. lots of pace on that one but long-on cuts it off
he gets away with this poor full toss! Williamson just punches it straight to long off
Anderson gets the same gift but he shows how to handle full tosses, whacks it over long-on with a heavy punch.
looks to crash this flatter delivery through cover but gets an inside edge down the pitch
uses his feet to get to the pitch of the delivery, drives it down to long off
another full toss, the batsman misses out again, punches it to mid off
this has to be a bonus wicket! Tossed up delivery outside off, Anderson goes for the big sweep, but this is too full for it and he drags it from outside off to his stumps. Number three for Sohail
flatter on off, the batsman punches it to mid-off
goes back and punches it to deep cover for a single
flatter and shorter, eased to long off for a single
sliding on the pads, the batsman tucks it to the right of midwicket
nicely tossed up, the batsman comes behind the line and defends
nice drift from the bowler, the batsman pushes it past the non-striker for a single
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
flatter and shorter, punched to long off from the back foot
comes forward and drives it firmly down the ground to long off
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman drives it uppishly through to long off
full and flighted, driven back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, the batsman drags it to midwicket where Afridi doesn't bend down, allows a single
punches the flatter delivery to long off
flatter, punched back to the bowler
pushes it down the leg side, it's a wide
looks for the sweep but this one hits his pads and rolls to short fine leg
length ball on off, Williamson defends it solidly
back of length outside off, Williamson dabs it straight to point
looks to crash it through point but finds Shehzad there again
waits in the crease and runs it down to third man to turn the strike over
on the pads, Ronchi clips this off his pads to deep backward square leg and scurries through for a couple
tight lines from Wahab, the batsman has no room and he defends the length delivery down the pitch
length delivery on the stumps, Williamson is in no hurry, defends it solidly
he waits and dabs the slower delivery down to third man
keeps it tight on the stumps, Ronchi defends it to cover
he goes for the pull but doesn't get any timing on that, more importantly for NZ, it flies through the gap at wide mid-on and rolls away to the boundary
superbly steered! This one is going away with the angle and Ronchi manages to squeeze it between the backward point fielder and the third man.. He uses the bowler's pace there
comes forward and defends the length delivery solidly to cover
goes back and across and clips the back of length delivery to midwicket
stays back and cuts the angled delivery to third man
slower delivery, punched straight to point
whips it nicely off the pads for a single to deep square leg
stays back and steers the length delivery to third man for a single

oh wow! Ronchi opens his stance a bit by getting his front leg out of the way, and punches this length delivery through extra cover. That was played on the up, but the timing was such that deep cover had no chance
length delivery outside off, the batsman slides it to third-man. Irfan has overstepped too
he gets a low full toss but he doesn't get any timing on it, pushed down to long off
he moves to the off side but the bowler follows him, Williamson defends in the end
loose shot from the batsman. He tries to glide the angled deliver but he is nowhere near it.. beaten
moves across to off and punches the fuller delivery towards cover where Younis Khan dives to his left to cut it off
another superb delivery! Williamson wanted to tuck it to the leg side but the angle kept taking it away from him.. Beats the outside edge
rides the bounce and punches it firmly to deep point
goes on the back foot and nudges the back of the length delivery to midwicket
a xerox copy of the previous delivery, tucked straight to midwicket
he gets to his half-century with a dab towards point. It's his sixth 50 in last seven matches this year.
looks to pull one that is not short enough, ends up playing it down the ground
looks for a repeat and does it well! he gets it off the middle and clobbers it to the cow corner
short delivery, but this is easily negotiated with Ronchi ducking under well in time
pushed through on the stumps, the batsman punches it to long on
it's a short delivery, only marginally short, and Ronchi short-arm jabs it over midwicket, against the turn, finds the boundary with precision
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman looks to drive it down the ground but gets an inside edge
he reaches out and defends the flighted delivery down the pitch
flatter and quicker, the batsman punches it to deep cover off the back foot
flighted on the pads, the batsman tucks it to the left of short fine leg for a quick single
length delivery outside off, the batsman chops it to the off side
shortish and going away from the batsman but Williamson had decided early, he goes for a flat-batted swat and whacks it through wide mid-on
he pushes it towards midwicket and comes through for a quick single
angled in from round the stumps, the batsman looks to flick but gets hit on the pads
looks for the tennis forehand but this was always rising on him, beats the top edge
back of length and rising delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to third man for a single
how good a pull is that! This is slow and down the leg side, he waits for it and swats it behind square on the leg side for yet another boundary. very well placed
goes back and punches the flatter delivery to deep extra cover for a quick couple
on the pads, the batsman punches it straight to midwicket

oh what a stunner! Sohail Tanvir takes a blinder at long off to buoy Pakistan. Ronchi went for a big hit on this flighted delivery, but this one turned and messed up with the batsman's timing.. he ended up chipping it towards long-off. Tanvir had to run forward and dive full length - always difficult - to grab this smartly. What a strike this is!
he is solidly behind this flatter delivery, defends it to midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, Williamson eases it to long on for a single
length delivery outside off, Williamson calmly dabs it to third man and jogs to the other end
back of length on off, the batsman pushes it through cover for his first runs
superb delivery! It cuts in away from the batsman, beating the outside edge as Williamson pushes forward
short delivery, Williamson gets inside the line and pulls it down to fine leg. The fielder - Tanvir - makes a valiant effort but can't keep it in this time
quicker delivery outside off, the batsman looks for a cut but misses
short and wide, Williamson gets up on his toes and crashes it behind point for four more
fuller delivery on off, Vettori walks across to the off side and flicks it through square leg with a lot of timing.. Superb shot
goes to the off side and this time he flicks it over the infield, behind square now. Shafiq slides and tries to keep it in, but his foot is touching the rope. So four more
shortish delivery, the batsman looks to play it towards point but gets a thick outside edge towards third man
slower delivery on off, the batsman chops it to the wicketkeeper
he comes forward and pushes the length delivery calmly to deep point
he stays back and clips it off his hips to fine leg
he comes down the pitch and chips the length delivery towards deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, the batsman comes down the pitch and squeezes it to deep cover
he takes off for a single to mid-off with a quick push
flatter, shorter, wider, Williamson gets a toe end to it as he looks to punch it through cover
dropped! By the keeper. The batsman came down the pitch, but gets a thick outside edge. Tough one for the keeper there. They also take a run off the deflection

goes for the reverse-sweep but this one slides off the glove/pad down to the boundary.. Over? No. Afridi wants a review. Was he hit in front of the off there? Can't say really. If he has missed, and it's out, it's another wicket for Haris Sohail, so important for him. What fun right at the end! It's missing off... so it's Game Over officially. Signalled four leg byes
